snippet: Federal courtrooms are overwhelmingly run by former prosecutors and corporate lawyers. The courts need a more professionally diverse cast of judges.
abstract: Editorial warns that federal courtrooms are overwhelmingly run by former prosecutors and corporate lawyers; holds this creates courts that are deprived of crucial perspectives and reduces public trust in the justice system; urges more diversity of professional experience, along with race, ethnicity and gender.
lead_paragraph: Federal courtrooms are overwhelmingly run by former prosecutors and corporate lawyers. The courts need a more professionally diverse cast of judges.
